description.narrative:
KAJARA SACCO is a member based organization, established in 2002, which provides financial services (savings and loans) to its approximately 2.500 members. The client base are individuals, groups (Rural producer Organizations, and Area Cooperative Enterprises) and institutions like schools and churches. The general goal of the project is the operationalization of KAJARA's expansion plans by making: 1. A financial plan for investment in new branches 2. An operational plan to implement for new branches
KAJARA SACCO is a member based organization, established in 2002, which provides financial services (savings and loans) to its approximately 2.500 members. The client base are individuals, groups (Rural producer Organizations, and Area Cooperative Enterprises) and institutions like schools and churches. KAJARA SACCO shows for the third year in a row an increased savings portfolio, loan portfolio and an increased share capital. Also their revenue/cost ratio is improving slowly towards a more efficient way of working, although there is still much room for improvement. KAJARA SACCO faces difficulties with fulfilling the need of their members in terms of available money to lend out and in addition, there is a demand driven plan to expand to 2 new rural areas. As a consequence KAJARA SACCO has applied for a grant at Abi Trust, although the operationalization of the plans has not yet started.
Increase competitiveness of KAJARA SACCO (by implementing tools to monitor costs, budgets and activities) and to support KAJARA with their expansion plans.
